stories.text:
Last night I had a dream. (No, this isn't a parable; I literally dreamed this last night.)

People wore a VR device that could also monitor the person's health. Facebook used that to monitor the user's use of oxygen, and used that to drive engagement - the more oxygen they were using, the more engaged they were. (I say "Facebook", though in my dream I didn't see a logo. It looked like an FB-style feed, though.)

That is, they were driving engagement to the point where it became a physically measurable load on the user. "Engagement" became a sap on their physical energy.

Just a nightmare?
stories.title: Tell HN: Dream/Nightmare of “Engagement”
Netflix released a horror movie written by a bot and it's spectacular

stories.text:
I can solve simple sudoku, well everyone can I guess. But when it comes to difficult levels, I fail. And I have never been able to solve a Rubik's cube.

My question is - can people solve these without any training or knowlegde of tricks or actual methods to solve them? Am I banging my head at the wrong wall? Should I learn about the methodology or is an average person supposed to solve these without any training?
stories.title: Ask HN: Is it possible to solve Sudoku or Rubik's Cube without training
